initial_greeting: I am the Bandit King... Name yourself!
talked_already: What's wrong? Couldn't get enough of me? Hahaha!

choices.text: I heard you know about the mayor's secret.

mayor_info.text: The mayor? Why do you ask?

mayor_suspicious.text: Interesting... You're sharper than you look. The mayor has been meeting with someone in the old mill at midnight.

mayor_casual.text: Hmph. He's just another corrupt official. Nothing special.

choices.text: What else can you tell me?

mayor_meeting.text: Some cloaked figure. Never seen their face. But I know they exchange a locked box each time.

choices.text: A locked box? Do you have the key?

key_question.text: Maybe I do... but information isn't free, friend.

choices.text: I'll trade you information about the treasure.

check_treasure_knowledge.text: Now we're talking! Tell me what you know.

choices.text: The treasure is hidden in the eastern caves.

no_treasure_knowledge.text: You don't know anything about the treasure. Don't waste my time!

treasure_trade.text: Eastern caves, eh? Alright, here's the key. The box contains a ledger of the mayor's dealings. Use it wisely.

choices.text: Thank you. This will be useful.
That's too much. I'll find another way.

payment_accepted.text: Smart choice. Here's the key. The box contains evidence of the mayor's corruption.

defiant_response.text: Suit yourself, tough guy. But you'll regret not taking my offer.

treasure_info.text: Ah, the legendary treasure! What makes you think I know about it?

choices.text: I heard you found a map.

treasure_response.text: Ha! Stereotypes. But yes, there's treasure in the eastern caves. Guarded by something nasty though.

treasure_map.text: You're well-informed. Yes, I have a map. But it's incomplete without the mayor's piece.

choices.text: The mayor has part of the map?

treasure_guard.text: Some kind of ancient construct. Brings down anyone who tries to take the treasure without the proper key.

choices.text: Where do I find this key?

treasure_key_hint.text: Word is the mayor's got it. Strange, isn't it? A bandit king and a corrupt mayor both interested in the same treasure...

map_connection.text: Exactly. We used to be... business partners. Until he betrayed me. That's why I'm out here now.

betrayal_story.text: We found the map together, years ago. He took his half and disappeared. Became mayor with that stolen treasure money, I suspect.

revenge_question.text: Revenge? No. I want what's mine. If you can get his half of the map, I'll split the treasure with you. 50-50.

deal_accepted.text: Excellent! Bring me the mayor's map piece and we'll find that treasure together. Don't try to double-cross me.

check_mayor_knowledge.text: Ah, so you've been asking around about the mayor. What did you learn?

choices.text: He has part of a treasure map.

already_know_meeting.text: Good. You're paying attention. If you follow him, you might learn something useful.

already_know_map.text: So you know about the map. Are you going to help me get it?

mayor_hint.text: Then keep digging. The mayor's secrets run deep.

confused_response.text: What are you babbling about? We haven't discussed that.

choices.text: My mistake. Let's talk about something else.

ask_more_or_leave.text: Anything else you want to know?

return_mayor_info.text: We already talked about the mayor. I've told you what I know.

return_treasure_info.text: I already told you about the treasure. Eastern caves, remember?

end_with_key.text: Use that key wisely. And remember, we never had this conversation.

end.text: Safe travels, stranger. Watch your back out there.
